features.name: Rage
features.desc: Using a bonus action, you can enter Rage. Rage is a primal power that makes you powerful

feature_data.name: Damage Resistance
feature_data.desc: You're resistant to the following damage types: Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing

feature_data.name: Rage Damage
feature_data.desc: When dealing damage with a Strength attack (using a weapon or an unarmed strike) you deal extra damage equal to the 'Rage Damage' property of your character's level

feature_data.name: Strength
feature_data.desc: You can roll with advantage on Strength checks and saving throws

feature_data.name: Damage Resistance
feature_data.desc: You're resistant to the following damage types: Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing

feature_data.name: Concentration
feature_data.desc: You're unable to concentrate or cast spells.

feature_data.name: Duration
feature_data.desc: Rage stays active until the end of your next turn or until you get incapacitated. you can extend your rage period by: making an attack roll against an enemy, forcing the enemy to make a saving throw or by taking a bonus action to extend the rage period

features.name: Unarmored Defense
features.desc: While Unarmored, your base AC is 10 + DEX modifier + CON modifier

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.desc: You are proficient with 2 weapon types of your choice. This grants you mastery properties of those weapons. Once per long rest you can train to change your chosen weapons.

features.name: Danger Sense
features.desc: you get an uncomfortable feeling when you think things arent right. When dodging things you can roll with advantage on DEX saving throws, unless you're incapacitated

features.name: Reckless Attack
features.desc: Don't think about defense for a bit and just attack. This gives you advantage on attack rolls, but also grants advantage for your enemies

features.name: Barbarian Subclass
features.desc: Gain a subclass for your barbarian character

features.name: Primal knowledge
features.desc: you get proficient in another skill from the skill list available for level 1 barbarians

features.name: Ability score improvement
features.desc: Improve your Ability Score or choose another feat you qualify for

features.name: fast movement
features.desc: While not in heavy armor, your speed increases by 10ft

features.name: Extra Attack
features.desc: You can do an extra attack on your turn

features.name: Subclass feature
features.desc: You gain a feature of your subclass

features.name: Feral Instinct
features.desc: You can roll with advantage on Initiative rolls

features.name: Instinct Pounce
features.desc: As part of the Rage-extending bonus action you can move half your speed when doing this (so you can walk extra)

features.name: Ability score improvement
features.desc: Improve your Ability Score or choose another feat you qualify for

features.name: Brutal Strike
features.desc: If you use Reckless Attack, you can forgo any Advantage on one Strength-based attack roll of your choice on your turn. The chosen attack roll mustn't have Disadvantage. If the chosen attack roll hits, the target takes an extra 1d10 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon or Unarmed Strike, and you can cause one Brutal Strike effect of your choice. You have the following effect options.

feature_data.name: Forceful Blow
feature_data.desc: The target is pushed 15 feet straight away from you. You can then move up to half your Speed straight toward the target without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

feature_data.name: Hamstring Blow
feature_data.desc: The target's Speed is reduced by 15 feet until the start of your next turn. A target can be affected by only one Hamstring Blow at a timeâ€”the most recent one.

features.name: Subclass feature
features.desc: You gain a feature of your subclass

features.name: Relentless Rage
features.desc: If you drop to 0 Hit Points while your Rage is active and don't die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed your hitpoints will equal double of your barbarian level.

features.name: Ability score improvement
features.desc: Improve your Ability Score or choose another feat you qualify for

features.name: Improved Brutal Strike
features.desc: You gain new ways to attack. You gain the following Brutal Strike options:

feature_data.name: staggering blow
feature_data.desc: The target will have disadvantage on their next saving throw and are unable to make an Opportunity attack

feature_data.name: sundering blow
feature_data.desc: Before your next turn, the next attack roll made by another creature against the target has a +5 bonus.

features.name: Subclass feature
features.desc: You gain a feature of your subclass

features.name: Persistent Rage
features.desc: When you roll for initiative, you gain all expended rage slots. can be used once a long rest

features.name: Ability score improvement
features.desc: Improve your Ability Score or choose another feat you qualify for

features.name: Improved Brutal Strike
features.desc: You can now make brutal strikes wit 2 effects. it deals 2d10

features.name: Indomitable Might
features.desc: When your rolled total for a strength check is less than your strength score, you can use your strength score for it instead

features.name: Epic Boon
features.desc: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat you qualify for

features.name: Primal Champion
features.desc: Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4, these scores can be a maximum of 25

subclasses.name: Path of the Zealot
subclasses.desc: You receive boons from a god or pantheon. Barbarians that walk this path usually are allies of a priest and others who follow their god/pantheon

features.name: Divine Fury
features.desc: You use Divine Power in your powerful strikes. Each turn, while you're in Rage, the first target you hit with an unarmed strike or a weapon takes 1d6 + half your barbarian level (round up) of extra damage of type Necrotic or Radiant (choose at attack)

features.name: Warrior of the gods
features.desc: You have a god/pantheon helping you during your fight. You have 4d12 available to heal yourself. You can take a bonus action to expend one of the d12's for a Hit Point boost. All expended dice are regained after a long rest and the maximum amount increases with 1d12 at level 6, 12 and 17

features.name: Fanatical Focus
features.desc: While in Rage and you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a bonus equal to your Rage Damage bonus. This roll must be used and can only be used once per active Rage

features.name: Zealous Presence
features.desc: A battle cry full of divine power roars across the battlefield as you take your bonus action to give up to 10 creatures in the range of 60ft advantage on their attack rolls and saving throws until the start of your next turn

features.name: Rage of the Gods
features.desc: When Rage is activated, you can transform into a divine warrior for a minute (or until you drop to 0hp). You can use this feature once per long rest and you will gain the following benefits:

feature_data.name: Flight
feature_data.desc: You can fly and hover. Fly speed is the same as your regular speed

feature_data.name: Resistance
feature_data.desc: You are resistent to the Necrotic, Psychic and Radiant damage types

feature_data.name: Revivification
feature_data.desc: You can revive a creature within 30ft of you when they have 0HP. You can make a reaction and expend one use of Rage to change the creatures Hit Points to the same number as your barbarian level

subclasses.name: Path of the World tree
subclasses.desc: You're connected to the cosmic tree named `Yggdrasil`. You use this cosmic tree as a means of dimensional travel and as a source for magic

features.name: Vitality of the Tree
features.desc: Your Rage is connected to the mighty life force of the World Tree. Because of this, you gain the following benefits:

feature_data.name: Vitality surge
feature_data.desc: You gain an amount of Temporary Hit Points equal to your barbarian level when you enter Rage

feature_data.name: Life giving force
feature_data.desc: At each start of your turn while in Rage, you can choose another creature within 10ft of you to gain Temporary Hit Points equal to an amount of d6's equal to your Rage Damage bonus. These hit points fade away when your rage ends.

features.name: Branches of the Tree
features.desc: You can summon spectral branches around a creature within 30ft of you that's starting its turn. This is a Reaction action. The target must make a saving throw (DC8 + STR modifier + Proficiency). if they fail you can teleport the target to any unoccupied area you can see and reduce its speed to 0 until the end of the current turn.

features.name: Battering Roots
features.desc: You have 10ft of extra range with Heavy or Versatile weapons as roots of the tree extend your reach.

features.name: Travel Along the Tree
features.desc: When Rage is activated, you can use a bonus action to teleport to an unoccupied area within 60ft. Once per Rage, you can increase the distance to 150ft and take 6 creatures that are within 10ft of you with you

subclasses.name: Path of the Wild Heart
subclasses.desc: You're related to animals and you learn magical ways to communicate with them

features.name: Animal Speaker
features.desc: You can cast Beast Sense and Speak with Animals as a ritual. Your spellcasting ability is WIS

features.name: Rage of the Wilds
features.desc: Your Rage is connected to the primal force of animals. Because of this, you gain one of the following benefits:

feature_data.name: Bear
feature_data.desc: You're resistant to every type of damage except for Force, Necrotic, Psychic or Radiant damage types while in Rage

feature_data.name: Eagle
feature_data.desc: You can do the Disengage and Dash actions as part of enabling Rage. While Rage is already active you can use a bonus action to do both of those actions

feature_data.name: Wolf
feature_data.desc: While in Rage your allies have Advantage on attack rolls against any enemy within 5ft of you

features.name: Aspect of the Wilds
features.desc: You get one of the following options. you can change your choice after a long rest:

feature_data.name: Owl
feature_data.desc: You have Darkvision of 60ft. If you already have this, increase the range of it by 60ft

feature_data.name: Panther
feature_data.desc: You have a climb speed of your regular speed.

feature_data.name: Salmon
feature_data.desc: You have a swim speed of your regular speed.

features.name: Nature Speaker
features.desc: You can cast Commune with Nature as a ritual. your spellcasting ability is WIS

features.name: Power of the Wilds
features.desc: When Rage is activated, you can have one of the following options:

feature_data.name: Falcon
feature_data.desc: You have a fly speed of your regular speed when unarmored.

feature_data.name: Lion
feature_data.desc: Enemies have disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you or other barbarians with this option.

feature_data.name: Ram
feature_data.desc: you can give larger or smaller creatures the prone condition when doing a melee attack.

features.name: Frenzy
features.desc: When doing a reckless attack during your Rage, the first target you hit takes extra damage (same damage type as the weapon or unarmed strike used for the attack) of an amount of d6's equal to your Rage Damage bonus

features.name: Mindless Rage
features.desc: You cannot be charmed or frightened while in rage. You can also end these conditions by entering rage

features.name: Retalliation
features.desc: When taking damage from a creature within 5ft of you, you can take a reaction to make a single melee attack against that creature with a weapon or an unarmed strike

features.name: Intimidating Presence
features.desc: You can use a bonus action to become very intimidating. One creature of your choice in a 30ft range has to make a WIS saving throw (DC 8 + STR modifier + Proficiency). If the creature fails it will be frightened for 1 minute. at the end of each turn of the creature it makes the saving throw again, ending his condition on success. Use once per long rest.
